commit_message:
Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by dbs_timeout in
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle and by default is set to 60s.

Change-Id: Ib95c6b7614631eed264d42e6cf61672b705e7893
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 15e21010a8a8594678afe385821ee804ec9e16c7)
(cherry picked from commit 223e786c5716015c7ac1bdda94feabcd9c79716a)
(cherry picked from commit 98042540864790372980ede921f4d3960140c20e)
(cherry picked from commit dad647277e932cc8c52b4e08772a77379647c97e)

commit_message:
Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by
OVNDBSPacemakerTimeout which will configure
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle (default is set to 60s)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692123/
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I1afb5f2ef31ec61b3b224e5e1672fb9f12bcb110

Derives NovaPCIPassthrough per SR-IOV node

This change is used to derive the pci_passthrough_whitelist parameters
automatically for all the SR-IOV nodes.

commit_message:
Use a real IP address for ironic-inspector endpoint_override

With managed boot this IP address will be used for the callback URL,
so it cannot be localhost.

Story: #1528920
Task: #37314

commit_message:
Migrate to Zuul v3 native jobs

This corrects the path handling in the CI and removes a lot of
redundancy in the CI definitions. Also adds fixed log collection
from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649526/ to make the CI pass.

Removes handling of ZUUL_CHANGES. It is not present in new jobs,
and its use case in Bifrost is completely unclear.

Eventually, we should rewrite the whole test-bifrost.sh in ansible,
but that's a much bigger task.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/test-bifrost.yaml
	zuul.d/bifrost-jobs.yaml

Change-Id: Id893e816a7806e7d75282628817288d8a34ab8af
(cherry picked from commit 4bb71fc481eb66463084cf07bdd781c98b67100b)

commit_message:
Skip 'firewall' tasks from ceph-ansible

The firewall is configured and managed by the specific TripleO
service, we should not interfere with that.

Change-Id: Ie26618857e99186782595eb862a92cfc39af2ae0
Closes-Bug: 1850777

commit_message:
Migrate to Zuul v3 native jobs

This corrects the path handling in the CI and removes a lot of
redundancy in the CI definitions. Also adds fixed log collection
from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649526/ to make the CI pass.

Removes handling of ZUUL_CHANGES. It is not present in new jobs,
and its use case in Bifrost is completely unclear.

Eventually, we should rewrite the whole test-bifrost.sh in ansible,
but that's a much bigger task.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/legacy/bifrost-integration-dhcp/run.yaml
	playbooks/legacy/bifrost-integration-dibipa-debian/run.yaml
	playbooks/legacy/bifrost-integration-tinyipa/run.yaml
	scripts/collect-test-info.sh
	scripts/test-bifrost.sh
	zuul.d/bifrost-jobs.yaml

Notes on stable/rocky backport:
* collect-test-info.sh is taken as is from the master patch
* the missing keystone job is added non-voting

Change-Id: Id893e816a7806e7d75282628817288d8a34ab8af
(cherry picked from commit 4bb71fc481eb66463084cf07bdd781c98b67100b)

commit_message:
Improve handling of empty resource_registry

It's possible that content["resource_registry"] might
not exist or be iterable so wrap the reference to it
with a try/except for a KeyError or TypeError and continue
the deployment without the empty resource_registry instead
of failing.

Change-Id: Ic7d88382a0ff15c24800f12ddbf69f13d6804b28
Closes-Bug: #1833743

commit_message:
Log OVS firewall conjunction creation

In order to assist debugging of OVS flows involving conjunctions, log
the conjunction ID and other pertinent details.  Without this, there is
no good way to verify the port was added to the correct conjunction.

Change-Id: Ie9c3eaa9c828ef5a0a68a286bc0465f2bcd00a4f

familly, the RDO package puts the heat binaries in /usr/bin.

commit_message:
Fix heat path for heat-engine service

The heat services do not start, because systemd Execstart path search for
binaries in /usr/sbin. When using distro install method for RH7 OS
familly, the RDO package puts the heat binaries in /usr/bin. The used
variable heat_uwsgi_bin must be replaced by heat_bin.
This patch put the correct variable in defaults/main.yml for heat-engine
systemd config.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/690010

Change-Id: I65f8f49f0c1aeaf6a486766a2dd10ccec81115a7

commit_message:
Implement zaza tests for heat charm

This patchset removes the amulet tests and ports them to use the zaza
framework.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/105

Code improvements and fixes

* Used correct templates for test-requirements.txt and tox.ini
* Fixed functional_test field in Makefile
* Removed admin passwords and tokens from bundle files
* Added source and openstack-origin for all bundles that need it
* Added placement charm to bionic-train bundle

Add configuration entries to tests.yaml

Change-Id: I53201690ce844daa9445cad3491f594b673b23fe
Closes-Bug: #1828424

commit_message:
Migrate to Zuul v3 native jobs

This corrects the path handling in the CI and removes a lot of
redundancy in the CI definitions. Also adds fixed log collection
from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649526/ to make the CI pass.

Removes handling of ZUUL_CHANGES. It is not present in new jobs,
and its use case in Bifrost is completely unclear.

Eventually, we should rewrite the whole test-bifrost.sh in ansible,
but that's a much bigger task.

Change-Id: Id893e816a7806e7d75282628817288d8a34ab8af
(cherry picked from commit 4bb71fc481eb66463084cf07bdd781c98b67100b)

commit_message:
Enable MP-BGP capabilities in Ryu BGP driver

This change enables all capabilties regardless of peer address
family, thereby enabling announcement of IPv6 prefixes over IPv4
sessions and vice-versa. Peers can opt in/out with capabilities
configured on the remote end of the session.

Change-Id: I7b241cdfddcecbdd8cdde2e88de35b9be6982451
Closes-Bug: #1784590
(cherry picked from commit fc2dae7c93eb8606bcf0c77b6691595f69502c20)

commit_message:
PSExtDriverTestCase: initialize variable in case of exception

Avoid the following when test_create_net_port_security_default
hits an exception before variable network is set:

UnboundLocalError: local variable 'network' referenced before assignment

Related changes:
 - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/188209/
 - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679399/

Change-Id: I494916567a4df2bef410e8dc54505c289bd55a61

commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

The new job tempest-full-py3-opensuse15 use the opensuse-15 nodeset,
change tempest-full-py3-opensuse150 to tempest-full-py3-opensuse15.

Change-Id: Ida6b3f115d987b85e811be246468acd290f6c911
(cherry picked from commit 604efd382a9ca32935f95da3de59136690ebf33f)

[{'created': '2019-10-29 13:07:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Check dnsmasq process is active when spawned

After spawning the "dnsmasq" process in the method
"Dnsmasq._spawn_or_reload_process", we need to check that the "dnsmasq"
process is running and could be detected by the ProcessManager instance
controlling it.

ProcessManager determines if a process is "active":
- If the network ID is in the cmdline used to execute the process.
- If the process is detected by psutil.Process(pid), returning the
  cmdline needed in the first condition.
- If the PID file exists; this is written by the dnsmasq process
  once is started and is needed in the second condition.

To make this feature available for any other process using
ProcessManager, the implementation is done in this class.

Change-Id: I51dc9d342c613afcbcfdc50a1d2811502748f170
Closes-Bug: #1849502
(cherry picked from commit 7c5ce50a0c9e09d2729ae1ce79d2623ccafca9ee)

commit_message:
Check dnsmasq process is active when spawned

After spawning the "dnsmasq" process in the method
"Dnsmasq._spawn_or_reload_process", we need to check that the "dnsmasq"
process is running and could be detected by the ProcessManager instance
controlling it.

ProcessManager determines if a process is "active":
- If the network ID is in the cmdline used to execute the process.
- If the process is detected by psutil.Process(pid), returning the
  cmdline needed in the first condition.
- If the PID file exists; this is written by the dnsmasq process
  once is started and is needed in the second condition.

To make this feature available for any other process using
ProcessManager, the implementation is done in this class.

Change-Id: I51dc9d342c613afcbcfdc50a1d2811502748f170
Closes-Bug: #1849502
(cherry picked from commit 7c5ce50a0c9e09d2729ae1ce79d2623ccafca9ee)

commit_message:
Add conditions to ceph roles for dependencies

This change adds several conditions to the ceph roles so that when
they're included as a dependency they're only run when required.
This will ensure we're optimizing the runtime while also making the
log output a little quieter.

Change-Id: If5a2a60ce6769164f16e92bf1d4220216507f45e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add binary_prefix=true argument to mysql uri

This patch adds the argument binary_prefix=true to MySQL uri if
OpenStack version is equal or greater than Rocky due to Python
upper-constraints [1]. This argument is required because of PyMySQL's
change from version 0.8 and on [2], in order to fix Gnocchi API
warnings like this [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/stable/rocky/upper-constraints.txt#L377
[2] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/master/CHANGELOG#L61-L64
[3] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/issues/847

Change-Id: Ie8b10209daa4de74427e175ef21ddf306a17a0ae
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>

commit_message:
[WIP] Adds option to override mysql credentials

Right now mysql_db and mysql_user ansible modules use mysql
credentials provided by the my.cnf file. This patch enables deployer
to use specific mysql hosts/credentials per service or globaly.

Change-Id: I59354e2253e495594fe97b10bca43947dc7219d6

subject: Store cross-references of layers in global view
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-30 16:48:50.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/image/test_image_uploader.py', '.gitignore', 'tripleo_common/image/image_export.py', 'tripleo_common/utils/image.py', 'tripleo_common/image/image_uploader.py'], 'message': 'Store cross-references of layers in global view

Also store information about images cross-referencing common layers
in the global view graph. Use that info to complete cross-linking
and cross-repo mounting (depending on the local/remote kind of the
referencing image).

Global view (graph) under-the-hood:

graf:
  local: #scope
    layer1:
     ref: <im1> # the reference image details for the layer1
     path: <>
     targets: # other images referencing that layer1, by any scope
       - im2: <kind> # either local or remote scope
       - im6: <kind>
  remote: #scope
    layer42:
      ref: <im2>
      path: <>
      targets:
	- im1: <>
	- im42: <>
    layer1: # yes, it may be tracked for both scopes as well
      ...

The resulting graph will be also saved as
./tripleo-container-image-prepare-graph.yaml for debugging purposes.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/691851

Change-Id: I0c9f145f57049389bff38f1eac6513d8f1bc4e8a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Store cross-references of layers in global view

Also store information about images cross-referencing common layers
in the global view graph. Use that info to complete cross-linking
and cross-repo mounting (depending on the local/remote kind of the
referencing image).

Global view (graph) under-the-hood:

graf:
  local: #scope
    layer1:
     ref: <im1> # the reference image details for the layer1
     path: <>
     targets: # other images referencing that layer1, by any scope
       - im2: <kind> # either local or remote scope
       - im6: <kind>
  remote: #scope
    layer42:
      ref: <im2>
      path: <>
      targets:
	- im1: <>
	- im42: <>
    layer1: # yes, it may be tracked for both scopes as well
      ...

The resulting graph will be also saved as
./tripleo-container-image-prepare-graph.yaml for debugging purposes.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/691851

Change-Id: I0c9f145f57049389bff38f1eac6513d8f1bc4e8a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-30 16:48:50.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/image/test_image_uploader.py', 'tripleo_common/image/image_uploader.py'], 'message': "Lock image layers for local operations as well

When copying a local layer to a registry we
do not issue a lock for the layer existance check. But we do,
when copying a layer from registry to registry. This doesn't look

Change-Id: Iaa1413047376b4287b874333300db9d74e7678e3
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Lock image layers for local operations as well

When copying a local layer to a registry we
do not issue a lock for the layer existance check. But we do,
when copying a layer from registry to registry. This doesn't look
like a consistent behavior, therefore issue a lock for both cases.

Change-Id: Iaa1413047376b4287b874333300db9d74e7678e3

commit_message:
Add xfsprogs to nova-compute

xfsprogs is required for formatting XFS ephemeral disk partitions
when format=xfs is specified as instance create failes with
'mkfs.xfs: No such file or directory' due to missing xfsprogs
package in the nova-compute container.

Closes-Bug: #1850610

Change-Id: Iaf3414464f3dd747427247339c6b201b352063cb

commit_message:
suse: switch to using upstream repos

This patch makes SUSE use the upstream repos for RabbitMQ and
the devel:languages:erlang:Factory for Erlang.

As all distros are using rabbit 3.8 we can drop checking
3.7 style cluster_status output.

Change-Id: Ifaba2611f987e4e135b7a28db6c6053ef63b0913

If ironic_serial_console_autoenable is set to true, ironic compute node
serial consoles are automatically enabled during kayobe overcloud post
configure. However, the baremetal-compute-serial-console.yml playbook
expects a variable called cmd to be defined, and set to 'enable' in
order to enable serial consoles. This patch fixes the issue.

We also add a conditional to only import the playbook when ironic is

commit_message:
Fix baremetal serial console autoenable

If ironic_serial_console_autoenable is set to true, ironic compute node
serial consoles are automatically enabled during kayobe overcloud post
configure. However, the baremetal-compute-serial-console.yml playbook
expects a variable called cmd to be defined, and set to 'enable' in
order to enable serial consoles. This patch fixes the issue.

We also add a conditional to only import the playbook when ironic is
enabled in the overcloud.

Change-Id: Ice26a113f9023b1a25a4af0552d07c5e95e64556
Story: 2006662
Task: 36924

commit_message:
Use Horizon project template for django jobs

Horizon defined a project template 'horizon-non-primary-django-jobs'
for django jobs. This patch use that template to run django jobs
here but there is no unit-test added in vitrage-dashboard to check 
django compatibility as of now and maybe we can add them in future.
For information please refer [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681969/

Change-Id: I6fd838618048f7cd373e477d176e9ad2ee8e3f09

commit_message:
Fail kolla-ansible early when not available in the PYTHONPATH

Starting with the Train release, kolla_ansible (the package) must be
available in the PYTHONPATH to run most playbooks.
It is documented.
This change makes the error message friendlier.

Change-Id: Icf0399d21b3fde8d530d73e6e7ee4a57665da276
Closes-bug: #1849943

commit_message:
Add Mcrouter to Memcached chart

Implementation of mcrouter service for memcached resiliency.
This also changes memcached to StatefulSet to support a
stable naming scheme, needed by mcrouter.

Change-Id: I4dade48b36854f26eb2f02725441a18136489258
Implements: blueprint memcached-resiliency

commit_message:
RabbitMQ - user management jobs

This adds the mq-init.py script which is used by each service that
connects to RabbitMQ. It creates policies (users, permissions and
vhosts) with which each service connects to the message queue.

Change-Id: I25803aff7730062410b59671614eddbd976d2d06

commit_message:
Unit test for checking cross-version migrations compatibility

Future incompatible changes in database schema, like removing,
renaming columns and tables can break rolling upgrades (upgrades when
ironic services are run at different versions simultaneously). This
patch bans schema changes which cause incompatibilities - specifically
drops and alters. Note that it is not bullet-proof - some incompatible
schema changes like adding incompatible constraints may still get through.

Change-Id: I86a08e8d3e2cf818e541d0fef97ce62c683cc928
Partial-Bug: #1502887
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <ruby.loo@intel.com>

commit_message:
Switch jobs to py3

- removed `USE_PYTHON3` from ironic-ipa-base since ironic-base
already has this configuration

- Enabled python3 for ipa-tempest-wholedisk-bios-ipmi-direct-tinyipa-src
and ipa-tempest-partition-bios-ipmi-direct-tinyipa-src

- Renamed ipa-tempest-dsvm-partition-ipmi-iscsi-tinyipa-python3 to
ipa-tempest-dsvm-partition-ipmi-iscsi-tinyipa

Change-Id: Ib955e93c19182dd6f16e00c8e8e92523d7b2e22b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-16 21:05:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Only allow one non-compute service in tests

There have been two recent issues [1][2] caused by starting multiple
instances of the same service in tests. This can cause races when the
services' (shared) state conflicts.

With this patch, the nexus of nova service starting,
nova.test.TestCase.start_service, is instrumented to keep track of how
many of each service we start. If a non-compute service is started more
than once, we fail.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1844174
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681059/

Change-Id: I56d3cb17260dad8b88f03c0a7b9688efb3258d6f
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-09-16 21:21:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Only allow one scheduler service in tests

There have been two recent issues [1][2] caused by starting multiple
instances of the same service in tests. This can cause races when the
services' (shared) state conflicts.

With this patch, the nexus of nova service starting,
nova.test.TestCase.start_service, is instrumented to keep track of how
many of each service we start. If a scheduler service is started more
than once, we fail.

We could probably do the same thing for conductor, though that's less
important (for now) because conductor is stateless (for now).

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1844174
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681059/ (not a nova service, but same
class of problem)

Change-Id: I56d3cb17260dad8b88f03c0a7b9688efb3258d6f

commit_message:
Only allow one scheduler service in tests

There have been two recent issues [1][2] caused by starting multiple
instances of the same service in tests. This can cause races when the
services' (shared) state conflicts.

With this patch, the nexus of nova service starting,
nova.test.TestCase.start_service, is instrumented to keep track of how
many of each service we are running. If we try to run the scheduler
service more than once, we fail.

We could probably do the same thing for conductor, though that's less
important (for now) because conductor is stateless (for now).

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1844174
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681059/ (not a nova service, but same
class of problem)

Change-Id: I56d3cb17260dad8b88f03c0a7b9688efb3258d6f

commit_message:
Switch to the opensuse-15 nodeset

We are trying to deprecate the opensuse-150 label type in favor of the
opensuse-15 label. The reason for this is opensuse 15, like centos,
doesn't support its older point releases and instead expects users to
keep up to date on its minor updates. This allows us to carry one fewer
image in opendev and ensures we are testing supported releases.

Change-Id: Id5c5398c4720ebfa3066b2172f9a8924b023376d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 21798, 'name': 'Bernard Cafarelli', 'email': 'bcafarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcafarel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26622, 'name': 'Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'neutron_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'neutron_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-23 20:18:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': 'Fix mismatch of tags in dnsmasq options

In some cases (I don't know exactly how) it may happend that
when new subnet, e.g. IPv6 is added to the network, subnets
can change their order based on uuid.
As before this patch we were using in dnsmasq options tags like
"tagN" for subnets (where N was just number based on position of
the subnet in the sorted list) it could happend sometimes that
dnsmasq ended up with mismatch of tags configured in "dhcp-range"
cmd option and set in "opts" file. That caused problem with serving
proper DHCP options to the vms.

This patch fixes this issue by using tags with format:
"subnet-<uuid>" where uuid is id of the subnet. That was it's not
based on order of subnets in the list and will always match with tag
configured in opts file for specific subnet.

As we was currently using port id as tag for "per port" DHCP options,
this patch changes that to use tags like "port-<uuid>" to make it
consistent with options configured "per subnet" and to make it easier
to debug from where each option comes.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py

Change-Id: Idaea33d62fa31edd7149ec916ec314438375724a
Partial-Bug: #1848738
(cherry picked from commit 88f2073526c2add7e8aa07656caec4c35c8b8459)
(cherry picked from commit a0730e684d54796fce0574bb314b679bcdd58c76)
(cherry picked from commit ba12b9e36916de4f4635de530defcbffc6dc1a53)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix mismatch of tags in dnsmasq options

In some cases (I don't know exactly how) it may happend that
when new subnet, e.g. IPv6 is added to the network, subnets
can change their order based on uuid.
As before this patch we were using in dnsmasq options tags like
"tagN" for subnets (where N was just number based on position of
the subnet in the sorted list) it could happend sometimes that
dnsmasq ended up with mismatch of tags configured in "dhcp-range"
cmd option and set in "opts" file. That caused problem with serving
proper DHCP options to the vms.

This patch fixes this issue by using tags with format:
"subnet-<uuid>" where uuid is id of the subnet. That was it's not
based on order of subnets in the list and will always match with tag
configured in opts file for specific subnet.

As we was currently using port id as tag for "per port" DHCP options,
this patch changes that to use tags like "port-<uuid>" to make it
consistent with options configured "per subnet" and to make it easier
to debug from where each option comes.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py

Change-Id: Idaea33d62fa31edd7149ec916ec314438375724a
Partial-Bug: #1848738
(cherry picked from commit 88f2073526c2add7e8aa07656caec4c35c8b8459)
(cherry picked from commit a0730e684d54796fce0574bb314b679bcdd58c76)
(cherry picked from commit ba12b9e36916de4f4635de530defcbffc6dc1a53)

commit_message:
Update help for image_cache_manager_interval option

The image_cache_manager_interval configuration option help is
updated to:

1. Fix formatting on possible values.
2. Describe the "large number of instances" scenarios to
   watch out for in bug 1804262.
3. Add related options.
4. Clarify the "0" default interval value so it is not confused
   with the 2400 default.

Change-Id: Ia182e758d975e76a6e6f14f29591cb2891d7c83a
Related-Bug: #1804262

commit_message:
OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

octavia is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: Ifc33eef511216325022614ddcc92f7d3c0169911

commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

Note that this is not a backport from master since master has handled it
differently, see https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683595.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/692137
Change-Id: I6c7f7867a4d63802626ca03a8cd8a0a0f715c70f

commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

Note this is not a backport, master has changed the job setup completly,
instead it just updates the jobs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/692137
Change-Id: Id242f736fbb732df9c122afbfe1e854516750fbb

commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use

subject: Restart certmnonger after registering system with IPA
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-29 15:09:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Restart certmnonger after registering system with IPA

If certmonger is not restarted when the server is registered with
IPA, then it may define the IPA CA as unreachable.  This results
in CA certs not being stored when cert requests are made with a -F
option.  Eventually, certmonger refreshes itself, but this can
take up to 8 hours.

We see this sometimes when doing brownfield deploys.  The ca cert
fails to be created for some requests, resulting in containers
being unable to load.

We fix this by simply restarting certmonger after enrollment, and
avoiding the whole confused state.

Change-Id: Id968a2d5170af1485417e41318e0187d79cd4aae
(cherry picked from commit bf0bc85ef42bd8d8b3540b1388d64c60e43a8907)
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-10-30 14:24:40.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/restart-certmonger-244416f537859bac.yaml', 'deployment/ipa/ipaclient-baremetal-ansible.yaml'], 'message': 'Restart certmnonger after registering system with IPA

If certmonger is not restarted when the server is registered with
IPA, then it may define the IPA CA as unreachable.  This results
in CA certs not being stored when cert requests are made with a -F
option.  Eventually, certmonger refreshes itself, but this can
take up to 8 hours.

We see this sometimes when doing brownfield deploys.  The ca cert
fails to be created for some requests, resulting in containers
being unable to load.

We fix this by simply restarting certmonger after enrollment, and
avoiding the whole confused state.

Closes-Bug: 1850647
Change-Id: Id968a2d5170af1485417e41318e0187d79cd4aae
(cherry picked from commit bf0bc85ef42bd8d8b3540b1388d64c60e43a8907)
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Restart certmnonger after registering system with IPA

If certmonger is not restarted when the server is registered with
IPA, then it may define the IPA CA as unreachable.  This results
in CA certs not being stored when cert requests are made with a -F
option.  Eventually, certmonger refreshes itself, but this can
take up to 8 hours.

We see this sometimes when doing brownfield deploys.  The ca cert
fails to be created for some requests, resulting in containers
being unable to load.

We fix this by simply restarting certmonger after enrollment, and
avoiding the whole confused state.

Closes-Bug: 1850647
Change-Id: Id968a2d5170af1485417e41318e0187d79cd4aae
(cherry picked from commit bf0bc85ef42bd8d8b3540b1388d64c60e43a8907)

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Aodh is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I12158c5f382f832da50d5be90906ca4a7dd8ccdc

We are trying to deprecate the opensuse-150 label type in favor of the
opensuse-15 label. The reason for this is opensuse 15, like centos,
doesn't support its older point releases and instead expects users to
keep up to date on its minor updates. This allows us to carry one fewer

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Switch to the opensuse-15 nodeset

We are trying to deprecate the opensuse-150 label type in favor of the
opensuse-15 label. The reason for this is opensuse 15, like centos,
doesn't support its older point releases and instead expects users to
keep up to date on its minor updates. This allows us to carry one fewer
image in opendev and ensures we are testing supported releases.

Change-Id: I1dc590011767675f84865c16cc0742cf10fbfac5

commit_message:
nova-net: Use deepcopy on value returned by NeutronFixture

A follow-up for Ib2f10a51bebd10cc69b78427b485aeac19f59141. If code in
nova modifies this it can mean our "authoritative" mock is no longer
authoritative. Fix this by deepcopying, like we do elsewhere.

Change-Id: I1d69e0e2739c6493724699fd2b80759c782d0714
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_floating_ips' functional tests

This is probably the most involved of all the changes and requires a
significant expansion of the NeutronFixture to mock floating IP
interactions. All the API samples were based off responses pulled from a
DevStack configuration using openstackclient and old versions of the
novaclient (where the 'floating-ip-*' commands were still present) in
debug mode.

Change-Id: Ib2f10a51bebd10cc69b78427b485aeac19f59141
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-04 17:50:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "fixtures: Add support for security groups

We're going to want to use this for realistic API samples. The samples
we're using here were taken from a DevStack deployment based on pre-RC1
Train code so they should be fairly reflective of what you'd see in a
real deployment.

Note that we also fix bugs seen with the mocks for 'create_port' and
'list_networks' neutron API functions. For the former, we weren't
properly merging the request port details meaning we weren't setting
some fields on the port, most significantly 'device_id'. For the latter,
it turns out it's possible to filter using a list of values and we
weren't handling that. Both are resolved now.

Change-Id: I3c94b61fc323fefbd1c8790c4a2f60cada29e86f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-10-05 12:21:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "fixtures: Add support for security groups

We're going to want to use this for realistic API samples. The samples
we're using here were taken from a DevStack deployment based on pre-RC1
Train code so they should be fairly reflective of what you'd see in a
real deployment.

Note that we also fix bugs seen with the mocks for 'create_port' and
'list_networks' neutron API functions. For the former, we weren't
properly merging the request port details meaning we weren't setting
some fields on the port, most significantly 'device_id'. For the latter,
it turns out it's possible to filter using a list of values and we
weren't handling that. Both are resolved now.

Also note that this effectively undoes a lot of the changes first
introduced in Ibbee7fd11c1aa254e399d302adbae69126e98262, particularly
around the responses for instances in a down cell, where we previously
changed things so a 'security_groups' field was present in the response.
This is okay since we're not creating interfaces and therefore don't
expect to have security groups present.

Change-Id: I3c94b61fc323fefbd1c8790c4a2f60cada29e86f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
fixtures: Add support for security groups

We're going to want to use this for realistic API samples. The samples
we're using here were taken from a DevStack deployment based on pre-RC1
Train code so they should be fairly reflective of what you'd see in a
real deployment.

Note that this effectively undoes a lot of the changes first introduced
in Ibbee7fd11c1aa254e399d302adbae69126e98262, particularly around the
responses for instances in a down cell, where we previously changed
things so a 'security_groups' field was present in the response. This
is okay since we're not creating interfaces and therefore don't expect
to have security groups present.

Change-Id: I3c94b61fc323fefbd1c8790c4a2f60cada29e86f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5dab78cb85309a39686be9cf44ed6864f7fc0f30
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5dab78cb85309a39686be9cf44ed6864f7fc0f30

commit_message:
Set tempest_image_dir to /opt/cache/files in openstack CI

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/640742 fix tempest_image_dir
default var to user's home tempest-image dir. But in OpenStack CI,
the cirros image is cached already and we can use the same path
and reuse the downloaded image.

Change-Id: If21e19ad436178bab30059a5637885e1dc8ec85b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-23 13:47:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_numa_servers.py'], 'message': 'Remove 'test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails' test

This never actually worked. What we wanted to do was test a setup where
we had two hosts, one with the necessary configuration needed for a
specific request and one without, and attempt to cold migrate the
instance from the former to the latter resulting in a fail. However,
because it's not possible to use different configuration for different
hosts, we were attempting to "break" the configuration on one host.
Unfortunately, the driver correctly detects this broken behavior,
resulting in an error message like so:

  ERROR [nova.compute.manager] Error updating resources for node test_compute1.
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "nova/compute/manager.py", line 8524, in _update_available_resource_for_node
      startup=startup)
    File "nova/compute/resource_tracker.py", line 867, in update_available_resource

  physnet foo is not present in host affinity set {0: set([])}

There isn't really an alternative. We can't configure compute nodes
separately so that's ruled out and the virt driver will correctly detect
any other attempts to break the configuration. Since the test never
actually worked, the correct thing to do seems to be to remove it.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove 'test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails' test

This never actually worked. What we wanted to do was test a setup where
we had two hosts, one with the necessary configuration needed for a
specific request and one without, and attempt to cold migrate the
instance from the former to the latter resulting in a fail. However,
because it's not possible to use different configuration for different
hosts, we were attempting to "break" the configuration on one host.
Unfortunately, the driver correctly detects this broken behavior,
resulting in an error message like so:

  ERROR [nova.compute.manager] Error updating resources for node test_compute1.
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "nova/compute/manager.py", line 8524, in _update_available_resource_for_node
      startup=startup)
    File "nova/compute/resource_tracker.py", line 867, in update_available_resource
      resources = self.driver.get_available_resource(nodename)
    File "nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 7907, in get_available_resource
      numa_topology = self._get_host_numa_topology()
    File "nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 7057, in _get_host_numa_topology
      physnet_affinities = _get_physnet_numa_affinity()
    File "nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 7039, in _get_physnet_numa_affinity
      raise exception.InvalidNetworkNUMAAffinity(reason=msg)
  InvalidNetworkNUMAAffinity: Invalid NUMA network affinity configured: node 1 for
  physnet foo is not present in host affinity set {0: set([])}

There isn't really an alternative. We can't configure compute nodes
separately so that's ruled out and the virt driver will correctly detect
any other attempts to break the configuration. Since the test never
actually worked, the correct thing to do seems to be to remove it.

Change-Id: I14637d788205408dcf9a007d7727358c03033dcd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Mark "block_migration" arg deprecation on pre_live_migration method

The block_migration argument to the pre_live_migration compute
method is not used so this marks it for deprecation and removal
in version 6.0 of the compute RPC API.

Change-Id: I78d0aeb04f101fed4ef0309f3d72d261cf51ba63

commit_message:
Move Destination object tests to their own test class

The TestDestinationObject class has been added
since Ic2bcee40b41c97170a8603b27b935113f0633de7.
The following test methods in the _TestRequestSpecObject class are for
the Destination object.

- test_destination_aggregates_default
- test_destination_require_aggregates
- test_destination_obj_make_compatible
- test_destination_forbidden_aggregates_default
- test_destination_append_forbidden_aggregates
- test_destination_delete_forbidden_aggregates

They should be moved to their own test class,
so move them to the test class.
In addition, some methods are merged into one test method.

Change-Id: I0bd9d44a61f16a703cd9c850d13d1f8f35e81ad7

commit_message:
Correct handling of ramdisk_params in (i)PXE boot

Currently only ipa-api-url is recognized there, since it's hardcoded
in the templates. Anything else is silently ignored. This patch
fixes it by wiring all provided options in pxe_append_params and
dropping the hardcoded ipa-api-url (provided by agent deploy).

Add some logging to make debugging such issues easier.

Change-Id: I573cf99d52a6965d64c2ed7a87cf901c12ea3fec
Story: #1528920
Task: #37255

commit_message:
Assess ceph request status until it is complete.

Due to a change in the ceph-client interface *1 the
storage-ceph.pools.available flag can be lost when the charm is
upgraded from an old version to the current version. To account for
this check the request status whenever there is an outstanding
ceph request.

*1 https://github.com/openstack/charm-interface-ceph-client/blame/master/requires.py#L107

Change-Id: I179df45af2fb2d4723cd579a1070ece0d18b5002
Closes-Bug: #1850618
(cherry picked from commit b6c42e3260c9a8cc65c123eb5ad77862b6b67572)

commit_message:
Move pre-3.44 Cinder post live migration test to test_compute_mgr

The previous patch (Id0e8b1c32600d53382e5ac938e403258c80221a0) created
_post_live_migration_remove_source_vol_connections() in an attempt to
split out _post_live_migration() into smaller more self-contained
methods. The test for the pre-3.44 Cinder API behavior was kept in
test_compute. test_compute runs API and compute services and
uses the database, and therefore should not receive new tests. Compute
API tests should go in test_compute_api, compute manager tests in
test_compute_mgr and anything that needs a running service and/or
database should go under functional/. While there will be no concerted
effort to "convert" test_compute (like for mox -> mock), it's still
good to do it when the opportunity arises. In addition, having unit
tests for two branches of the same method in different files is just
confusing. This patch removes the pre-3.44 Cinder API unit test from
test_compute and adds a new one right above the existing test for
post-3.44 Cinder API behavior in test_compute_mgr.

Change-Id: I2b07fd03fd3ba7662695384940ceda479fcf9f0a

commit_message:
Refactor volume connection cleanup out of _post_live_migration

The _post_live_migration method is huge and hard to review/test/
maintain in isolation so we need to break down the complexity.
To that end this change refactors the source host volume connection
cleanup code into another method which also allows us to simplify
a couple of unit tests that target that specific set of code.
The error handling in that new method is tested by the functional
test class LiveMigrationCinderFailure.

Change-Id: Id0e8b1c32600d53382e5ac938e403258c80221a0

commit_message:
Fix update share network tests and skip exception issue

After fixing a bug that was allowing share network update when it
shouldn't, the test that validates the share network creation and
update started failing. An additional validation was introduced and
it caused the new bug. This patch fixes the test and make it work
properly.
In addition this patch fixes test classes that are raising a skip
exception inside the setUpClass function and failing due to testtool
issue #272.

Closes-Bug: #1849728
Closes-Bug: #1849377
Related-Bug: #1846836
Co-Author: Carlos Eduardo <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I5b27ee4a9e844ea48dc9324bcf38f5767223717f
(cherry picked from commit 0ca91287acffece4f78451e160fafa040a988f5a)

commit_message:
api-ref: remove mention about os-migrations no longer being extended

When 2.23 was implemented people thought the GET /os-migrations API
would no longer be extended, but it has twice since then with 2.59
and 2.66 so let's remove the misleading comment with 2.23 in the REST
API version history doc.

Change-Id: I76e5238fdf8e96062dc8bd23777c358c572a5dc5

commit_message:
Convert ServiceNetMap evals to hiera interpolation

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514707/ added the net_ip_map
to hieradata, we can look up the per-network bind IPs via hiera
interpolation instead of heat map_replace.

In some cases the ServiceNetMap lookup is used for other things,
but anywhere we make use of the "magic" translation via NetIpMap
is changed the same way.

This will enable more of the configuration data to be exposed per
role vs per node in a future patch (to simplify our ansible
workflow).

Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie3da9fedbfce87e85f74d8780e7ad1ceadda79c8
(cherry picked from commit 3a7baa8fa6fa8dd6735f38d6236e8a2cb5d34659)

is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and

commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

Update all jobs. There were already a few opensuse-15 jobs, so remove
some opensuse-150 jobs since we can use the -15 ones instead.

Change-Id: I695b07933ffcbdf51213442155a9a0e2eab12bbc
(cherry picked from commit af588a44aa51fb610b8ef8ab8bb36daaebdb3f69)

More specifically, it causes all generic Ironic driver interface
implementations which use the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF)

'redfish' and 'idrac' drivers, respectively.

commit_message:
Exclude sushy 1.9.0

sushy 1.9.0 contains critical Redfish message registry bugs which cause
the Ironic generic 'redfish' hardware type (driver) to not work against
at least some Dell EMC hardware.

More specifically, it causes all generic Ironic driver interface
implementations which use the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF)
Redfish protocol, including 'redfish*' and 'idrac-redfish*', to not
work. Those interface implementations are supported by the generic
'redfish' and 'idrac' drivers, respectively.

Story: 2006702
Task: 37317
Change-Id: I0efe08b1d10bde8ce06314eb84bae0286ce75e21
(cherry picked from commit dae99a97409ce42b3ae5a7344fa8fc01514a0b7c)

commit_message:
undercloud-setup: fixed two runtime warnings

Non fatal but confusing and avoidable error:
/bin/sh: /etc/ci/mirror_info.sh: No such file or directory

[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Invoking "pip" only once while using a loop via
squash_actions is deprecated. Instead of using a loop to supply multiple items
and specifying `name: "{{ item }}"`, please use `name: ['pip', 'setuptools']`
and remove the loop. This feature will be removed in version 2.11. Deprecation
warnings can be disabled by setting deprecation_warnings=False in ansible.cfg

Change-Id: I1495dd11405613b7ca63e81cfec8c3eead2dbece

commit_message:
token: consistently decode binary types

Ensure that any binary types unpacked from message payloads
are correctly converted from binary to text type.

Under Python 3 msgpack returns the serialized input as a
byte string. Similar to other msgpack'd values in the payload,
we need to explicitly decode it to a string value.

This is specifically more of an issue under Python 3; however
the decode operation is safe back to Python 2 so there is no
need to limit the decode codepath to just Python 3.

Conflicts:
    keystone/token/token_formatters.py

Note: the file conflict is caused by patch
I9529d6bee3e5bb1f618f40f225f69e2ad7e3f64a which is only present in
stable/train.

Change-Id: Ib1073acf5677a60714d0a386de3bcd14ce6cd134
Closes-Bug: 1832265
(cherry picked from commit ffa0918f5a92fd18c86703916d768012b0bea61b)

be the cause. Add keystone to required-projects for its job.

commit_message:
Switch to the opensuse-15 nodeset

We are trying to deprecate the opensuse-150 label type in favor of the
opensuse-15 label. The reason for this is opensuse 15, like centos,
doesn't support its older point releases and instead expects users to
keep up to date on its minor updates. This allows us to carry one fewer
image in opendev and ensures we are testing supported releases.

Change-Id: Ifa3e79514f52bc78dbaf6496188075c24366d86c

commit_message:
WIP: SchedulerReportClient.set_aggregates_for_provider

Introduce SchedulerReportClient.set_aggregates_for_provider, which
accepts a provider UUID and list of aggregate UUIDs to push back to the
placement API.  On success, the local ProviderTree cache is updated
appropriately.  On failure, an exception is raised.  If the failure was
a conflict (409), the exception is a subclass of PlacementAPIConflict so
that the caller may decide to refresh and retry.

Depends-On: cdent's to-be-proposed placement API microversion for RP
            aggs+generation
WIP: replace 1.__AGG_GENERATION_MICROVERSION__ with real microversion
     from the above.

Change-Id: I91679a92f926d486ca6092242253a3d4f31f7c3b

When a specific action is created, we do not know what action this action takes

commit_message:
Add cluster_id to action filter in API

Current, an action was created haven't information of a cluster.
When a specific action is created, we do not know what action this action takes
in a cluster and when we execute the query API:

GET http://senlin_host:8777/actions

so many actions are returned even though we can limit using parameters
such as name, target, action, status combined with limit and marker.
But, we can't just get the actions executed in a particular cluster.
So, I want us to be able to do this by enabling the query with a cluster_id parameter.
To accomplish this, I need to modify the schema of
action models and action tables in the database of senlin service.

Change-Id: I49d172414eecf9158192cf0869abb91822ee2226

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-12 18:17:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix wrong disk size for sparse flat files

The libvirt driver creates flat disks as sparse by default. However,
it always returns over_committed_disk_size=0 for flat disks
in _get_instance_disk_info(). This incorrect data ends up being reported
to the scheduler in the libvirt driver's get_available_resource() via
_get_disk_over_committed_size_total(). _get_instance_disk_info() should use
allocated blocks, not file size, when calculating over_commited_disk_size for
flat disks.

Closes-Bug: #1593155

Change-Id: I593a913779746730587df313a24e64680891e515
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2016-11-13 06:54:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix wrong disk size for sparse flat files

commit_message:
Fix wrong disk size for sparse flat files

The libvirt driver creates flat disks as sparse by default. However,
it always returns over_committed_disk_size=0 for flat disks
in _get_instance_disk_info(). This incorrect data ends up being reported
to the scheduler in the libvirt driver's get_available_resource() via
_get_disk_over_committed_size_total(). get_instance_disk_info() should use
allocated blocks, not file size, when calculating over_commited_disk_size for
flat disks. We can just use qemu-img tool to file disk size same as qcow2.

Closes-Bug: #1593155

Change-Id: I593a913779746730587df313a24e64680891e515

commit_message:
Adds new molecule testing for tripleo-container-manage

This test ensure the "create" part is working fine with an easy and
simple container. The container-create and default scenario have been
consoldated so its running one complete test for now.

Change-Id: I9139c7b63c15739a1a95d913acb1128af299ce97
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2017-01-12 14:50:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'config options: remove libvirt imagecache

Config options related to imagecache should be removed.
However, it is not currently entirely possible due to
the upgrade issue - if someone is doing a leap frog
upgrades and would not run Ocata for a longer period of
time there is high probability that the imagechace file
will still be around after the upgrade.

This patch removes ``checksum_base_images`` and
``checksum_interval_seconds``. Default value of
``remove_unused_resized_minumum_age_seconds`` has been
changed from 3600 to 0 to address the problem described
above. This option should be removed after Ocata.

Change-Id: I7b422f3bb4d61f91574be4df612fa7db5f83533a
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-ocata

time there is high probability that the imagechace file
will still be around after the upgrade.

This patch removes ``checksum_base_images`` and
``checksum_interval_seconds``. Default value of
``remove_unused_resized_minumum_age_seconds`` has been
changed from 3600 to 0 to address the problem described
above. This option should be removed after Ocata.

Change-Id: I7b422f3bb4d61f91574be4df612fa7db5f83533a
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-pike

commit_message:
conf: Remove libvirt imagecache

Config options related to imagecache should be removed. However, it is
not currently entirely possible due to the upgrade issue - if someone is
doing a leap frog upgrades and would not run Ocata for a longer period
of time there is high probability that imagecache files will still be
around after the upgrade.

Removes ``checksum_base_images`` and ``checksum_interval_seconds``, and
set the default value of ``remove_unused_resized_minumum_age_seconds``
to 0 (from 3600) to address the problem described above. This option is
also deprecated to allow for its removal after Pike.

Change-Id: I7b422f3bb4d61f91574be4df612fa7db5f83533a
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-pike
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

If a failover ran on an amphora and was unsuccessful and reverted, it
would mark the amp status "DELETED" and un-busy the health record.
It would then be picked up on the next failover check, start failing
over, and break early since it appeared to be "unallocated".

Also, housekeeping can now clean up expired amphora records based on the
amphora's updated_at time instead of the health record's time, which
means the records won't be immediately cleaned up anymore after they go
through failover flows.

commit_message:
Fix amp failover where failover already failed

If a failover ran on an amphora and was unsuccessful and reverted, it
would mark the amp status "DELETED" and un-busy the health record.
It would then be picked up on the next failover check, start failing
over, and break early since it appeared to be "unallocated".

Also, housekeeping can now clean up expired amphora records based on the
amphora's updated_at time instead of the health record's time, which
means the records won't be immediately cleaned up anymore after they go
through failover flows.

Conflicts:
    octavia/controller/worker/controller_worker.py
    octavia/controller/worker/flows/amphora_flows.py
    octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/flows/test_amphora_flows.py
    octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/test_controller_worker.py
    tools/create_flow_docs.py

Change-Id: I848b7fc69b977fcb39f8a07e2ea5fc7bd37b5c7a
(cherry picked from commit 96cce3ed74c63e5756e216a8e48c60de09b027c2)

subject: Fix nova scheduler down after first docker restart
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-24 14:03:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Restart nova scheduler to refresh cell cache

Reloading nova-scheduler is necessary after new cells have been created
to refresh the cell cache.  Ideally we would send a SIGHUP, but due
to a Docker bug (https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/11065) this will
cause the container to be stopped if we restart Docker or reboot the
server.

This change switches to restarting the nova-scheduler container.

Change-Id: Ief73bbd24568d6941384ea3330ab45f11aa42d37
Closes-Bug: #1845244
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-10-25 08:01:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix nova scheduler down after first docker restart

Due to a Docker bug [1] we cannot use Docker to send
SIGHUP to the container because it will mark it as
stopped.
This patch sends the signal directly to the process,
bypassing Docker.

'changed_when: false' is also removed from the
relevant task as it definitely changes the state.
In the future we could do the refresh only if
there really is a need for another one.

[1] https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/11065

Change-Id: Ief73bbd24568d6941384ea3330ab45f11aa42d37
Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1845244

commit_message:
Fix nova scheduler down after first docker restart

Due to a Docker bug [1] we cannot use Docker to send
SIGHUP to the container because it will mark it as
stopped.
This patch sends the signal directly to the process,
bypassing Docker.

'changed_when: false' is also removed from the
relevant task as it definitely changes the state.
In the future we could do the refresh only if
there really is a need for another one.

[1] https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/11065

Change-Id: Ief73bbd24568d6941384ea3330ab45f11aa42d37
Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1845244

commit_message:
prevent removing numa_topology usage info from DB

Basically this is reverting patch of below.

commit b6edbce9b3b092581eeda6be15059a1ba2bfcfdf
Author: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
Date:   Thu Sep 8 19:46:24 2016 +0800

    Ensure ResourceProvider/Inventory created before add
    Allocations record

Because resources in the _copy_resources() only contains basic
information about host numa_toplogy without usage, updating DB at
here is to overwrite previous NUMA usage information in the DB.
The usage will never be recovered thereafter since
_resource_change() in the _update() regards as there are no changes
indeed.

Closes-Bug: #1729621
Closes-Bug: #1739349
Related-Bug: #1621437
Change-Id: I6a488cb9c2744cd34209f718462f00160849d968
Signed-off-by: Minho Ban <mhban@samsung.com>

1.if rp create failed because of endpoint, report-client reload
  keystone session and raise exception. rt catch the exception
  and init the old_resource, cause _update() call report-client
  again next period.

2.delete two duplicate _update() in _init_compute_node(), because
  _update() while called at end of _update_available_resource.
  Too many period db actiions in large scale clusters increase the
  load of database.

commit_message:
[placement] fix rp create failed when late placement endpoint

If rp create failed because the placement endpoint is not yet available,
the report-client reload keystone session and raise exception. rt catch
the exception and init the old_resource, cause _update() call
report-client again next period.

Related-Bug: #1697825

Change-Id: Id54d06b13c9f655d78c7ea19313958060076a9a2

commit_message:
A way to keep the UEFI nvram contents on libvirt+qemu/kvm

Nova support boot UEFI instance on libvirt+qemu/kvm, but stop and
start the UEFI instance will lead to redefine the instance domain,
every time undefine will delete the uefi nvram, it stores the boot
information of the UEFI instance as MBR boot sector, define a
domain will create a new file from template, so instance will be
lost the boot information at next boot.

This commit is intended to solve this problem, this nvram needs to
be a local file, so we can backup the nvram file before undefined
and restore it before next boot.

Change-Id: If481a093c9816656cbfd936336b41d92ea5f28ba
Closes-Bug: #1633447

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 20:36:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add granularity to os-services API

The Nova Compute services (os-services) API is not granular enough in
the sense that multiple APIs check the same policy action for list,
update, and delete. This does not allow operators with strict
security requirements to have different roles that can perform
certain os-services APIs but not others - it currently is all or
nothing. As it currently stands, listing, updating, and deleting
compute services checks the single policy action
'os_compute_api:os-services' - which prevents operators who want read
only roles or other sub-admin type roles. To further achieve RBAC
granularity, this patch adds new policy actions to the os-services
API.

To address backwards compatibility, this patch leverages the
'verify_deprecated_policy' method [1] which allows the existing
policy action 'os_compute_api:os-services' or the new actions to be
used.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/policy.py#L230

Closes-Bug: #1778994

Change-Id: Ie8579300792d3ceab1e5c37eade47e599207666f

the sense that multiple APIs check the same policy action for list,

implemented:

  - Introduce the new rules with new default roles
  - Keep enforcing the old rules with same default for deprecation period
  - Give warning for user about switching to old rules to new rules

    new rule as soft enforcement only as it should not effect any user for
    deprecation period
  - After deprecation period. we will remove the old rules and keep enforcing
      the new rules only

commit_message:
Add granularity to os-services API

The Nova Compute services (os-services) API is not granular enough in
the sense that multiple APIs check the same policy action for list,
update, and delete. This does not allow operators with strict
security requirements to have different roles that can perform
certain os-services APIs but not others - it currently is all or
nothing. As it currently stands, listing, updating, and deleting
compute services checks the single policy action
'os_compute_api:os-services' - which prevents operators who want read
only roles or other sub-admin type roles. To further achieve RBAC
granularity, this patch adds new policy actions to the os-services
API.

To address backwards compatibility, the following deprecation strategy is
implemented:

  - Introduce the new rules with new default roles
  - Keep enforcing the old rules with same default for deprecation period
  - Give warning for user about switching to old rules to new rules
  - Note we will enforce the old rules as it is till deprecation period and
    new rule as soft enforcement only as it should not affect any user for
    deprecation period
  - After deprecation period, we will remove the old rules and keep enforcing
    the new rules only

Closes-Bug: #1778994
Partially Implements: bp granular-api-policy
Change-Id: Ie8579300792d3ceab1e5c37eade47e599207666f

commit_message:
Fix update share network tests and skip exception issue

After fixing a bug that was allowing share network update when it
shouldn't, the test that validates the share network creation and
update started failing. An additional validation was introduced and
it caused the new bug. This patch fixes the test and make it work
properly.
In addition this patch fixes test classes that are raising a skip
exception inside the setUpClass function and failing due to testtool
issue #272.

Closes-Bug: #1849728
Closes-Bug: #1849377
Related-Bug: #1846836
Co-Author: Carlos Eduardo <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I5b27ee4a9e844ea48dc9324bcf38f5767223717f

commit_message:
For instances end up in cell0, set its availability_zone to None.

Instances that have not yet been created will be created in cell0,
after the availability zone is changed, but the available_zone in
the instances database of the instance does not change, which will
cause fail to filter the list of instances by the available zone.

Change-Id: I417318b98b7db77b22c768c7114f33c890616174

commit_message:
Assess ceph request status until it is complete.

Due to a change in the ceph-client interface *1 the
storage-ceph.pools.available flag can be lost when the charm is
upgraded from an old version to the current version. To account for
this check the request status whenever there is an outstanding
ceph request.

*1 https://github.com/openstack/charm-interface-ceph-client/blame/master/requires.py#L107

Change-Id: I179df45af2fb2d4723cd579a1070ece0d18b5002
Closes-Bug: #1850618

commit_message:
Rollback instance vm_state to original where instance claims failed

When rebuild_claim or resize_claim failed because of
ComputeResourceUnavailable exception, we set the vm_state
to original vm_state.

Change-Id: I32f574d4742d0bd1e0d60196cc0756ec6ece7988
Closes-Bug: #1784983

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-30 08:24:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix instance delete stuck in deleting task_state

During instance deletion if rabbitmq-server crashes
after setting instance task_state to 'DELETING' or
'SOFT_DELETING'. That instance will get deleted only
on nova-compute restart.

Extend periodic method _run_pending_deletes to delete
instances stuck in 'DELETING' or 'SOFT_DELETING' task_state.

Record the timestamp of last valid delete request in
instance's system_metadata field. This timestamp is used to
judge whether the deletion is time out and the instance
need to be deleted in _run_pending_deletes.

Rreferences:
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281782
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/294491

Change-Id: I43e995c3f5d71e56f0b0e136e45a307e329d7ae4
Closes-Bug: #1543511

commit_message:
Fix instance delete stuck in deleting task_state

During instance deletion if rabbitmq-server crashes
after setting instance task_state to ``DELETING`` or
``SOFT_DELETING``. That instance will get deleted only
on nova-compute restart.

1) Add periodic task _cleanup_instances_stuck_in_deleting_task
to delete instances stuck in ``DELETING`` or ``SOFT_DELETING``
task_state. The periodic interval is
``running_deleted_instance_poll_interval`` conf option.

2) Soft delete instance when nova-compute restart if the
instance's task_state is ``SOFT_DELETING``.

Rreferences:
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281782
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/294491

Change-Id: I43e995c3f5d71e56f0b0e136e45a307e329d7ae4
Closes-Bug: #1543511

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2018-09-27 01:52:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Unable to delete volume when a vmware instance bfv is failed.

when creating a vmware instance from a volume is failed,
vm goes to error state, the volume is in "in use" state, 
and after deleting the vm, the state of the volume is still in 
"in use" and can't be deleted.

The reason of this bug is : When VM failed to boot, an operation of 
detach volume will be execute, but there is no VM in vmware ESXI, so ,
it will raise an exception: InstanceNotFound, so the belowing flow will 
not be execute.Finally, the volume is in "in use" status.
Though this change , we catch the InstanceNotFound exception, and ignore
it, let the flow go on, so that the status of volume can be set to 
"avalible"

Closes-Bug:#1774137

commit_message:
Catch the not found exception when powering off a vmware instance

Bug description:
when creating a vmware instance from a volume is failed,
vm goes to error state, the volume is in "in use" state,
and after deleting the vm, the state of the volume is still in
"in use" and can't be deleted.
The reason of this bug is : When VM failed to boot, an operation of
detach volume will be execute, but there is no VM in vmware ESXI, so ,
when powering off this instance in _detach_instance_volumes(),
it will raise an exception: InstanceNotFound.
Finally, the volume is in "in use" status.
Though this change , we catch the InstanceNotFound exception,
and let the flow in destroy() go on,
so that the status of volume can be set to "avalible"

Closes-Bug:#1774137

Change-Id: I987d9b46c82b66ecc0ef2453bdd7fce6d3a7810d

commit_message:
Add compute service support for attach/detach root volume

This patch bumps compute service version to 38 to indicate
that attach/detach root volume is supported. It will be checked
in compute/api.py when handling root volume when attaching/detaching.

This patch also added a new method reset_fields_for_detached_root_bdm()
to BlockDeviceMapping obj, it will be used in attach/detach root
volume workflow since in these cases, we want to keep the BDM record
but reset some fields.

Implements: blueprint detach-boot-volume

Change-Id: I073da489005d8f746efcbefd413d20b978be44fa

subject: Detach/Attach root volume API changes

Change-Id: I759d4a7cce56047d21e91c2135e0414c243f99fd
', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2019-02-25 08:16:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Detach/Attach root volume API changes

Added support for detaching a root volume and attaching a root volume by
specify ``is_root=True`` when attaching in microversion 2.70. These
actions will be only allowed to perform on instances in ``STOPPED``,
``SHELVED`` and ``SHELVED_OFFLOADED`` status. If try to request ``START``
or ``UNSHELVE`` action on instances without ``root volume``, the
corresponding API will reply ``HTTP 403``.

Added support for including the ``boot_index``field in
``GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments`` and

commit_message:
Detach/Attach root volume API changes

Added support for detaching a root volume and attach a root
volume by specify ``is_root=True`` when attaching. These
actions will be only allowed to perform on instances in
``SHELVED_OFFLOADED`` status. If try to request ``unshelve`` an
instance without root volume, the corresponding API will reply
``HTTP 409``.

Added support for including the ``boot_index`` field in the responses
of:

* POST /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments (attach)
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments (list)
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments/{volume_id} (show)

Implements: blueprint detach-boot-volume

Change-Id: I759d4a7cce56047d21e91c2135e0414c243f99fd

commit_message:
Fix update share network functional test

After fixing a bug that was allowing share network update when it
shouldn't, the test that validates the share network creation and
update started failing. An additional validation was introduced in
the fix for this bug, and this was this test failure cause. This
patch fixes the test and make it work properly.

Change-Id: Id588ee74ac50b5e63c83df5cde3328861e3f3d76
Closes-Bug: #1849377

commit_message:
Make multi-platform support more maintainable

Avoids use of extensive platform dependenc conditionals inside the
tasks as they easily get out of control when trying to support
multiple distributions and releases.

This patterns allows us to add support for new distributions by
only changing the vars/ configurations.

Based on https://docs.sbarnea.com/ansible/distro-vars

Change-Id: I0b9cfd056338fb0f529b69cf52b405e0fa5368e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 15:01:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'libvirt: Introduce SMM (Systems Management Mode) config class

The SMM[2] hypervisor feature is a prerequisite to support UEFI Secure
Boot with OVMF (Open Virtual Machine Firmware), which is aimed to be
added as a future future[1].

This shows up in a Nova guest XML as:

    ...
    <features>
      <acpi/>
      <apic/>
      <smm state='on'/>
    </features>
    ...

The purpose[3] of SMM in this context is:

    "(virtual) hardware separation between the runtime guest OS and the
    firmware (OVMF), with the intent to make Secure Boot actually
    secure, by preventing the runtime guest OS from tampering with the
    variable store and S3 [meaning: suspend to RAM] areas."

[1] (WIP spec) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/506720/ -- Add ability
    for OVMF Secure Boot
[2] http://wiki.osdev.org/System_Management_Mode
[3] https://github.com/tianocore/edk2/tree/master/OvmfPkg

Change-Id: I1a30d8ed4ebe6c22eefd2d79322a24ae08aa7216

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2017-12-22 18:16:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/config.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_config.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Introduce SMM (System Management Mode) config class

The SMM[2] hypervisor feature is a prerequisite to support UEFI Secure
Boot with OVMF (Open Virtual Machine Firmware), which is aimed to be
added as a future future[1].

This shows up in a Nova guest XML as:

    ...

      <acpi/>
      <apic/>
      <smm state='on'/>
    </features>
    ...

The purpose[3] of SMM in this context is:

    "(virtual) hardware separation between the runtime guest OS and the
    firmware (OVMF), with the intent to make Secure Boot actually
    secure, by preventing the runtime guest OS from tampering with the
    variable store and S3 [meaning: suspend to RAM] areas."

    for OVMF Secure Boot

commit_message:
libvirt: Introduce SMM (System Management Mode) config class

The SMM[2] hypervisor feature is a prerequisite to support UEFI Secure
Boot with OVMF (Open Virtual Machine Firmware), which is aimed to be
added as a future future[1].

This shows up in a Nova guest XML as:

    ...
    <features>
      <acpi/>
      <apic/>
      <smm state='on'/>
    </features>
    ...

The purpose[3] of SMM in this context is:

    "(virtual) hardware separation between the runtime guest OS and the
    firmware (OVMF), with the intent to make Secure Boot actually
    secure, by preventing the runtime guest OS from tampering with the
    variable store and S3 [meaning: suspend to RAM] areas."

[1] (WIP spec) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/506720/ -- Add ability
    for OVMF Secure Boot
[2] http://wiki.osdev.org/System_Management_Mode
[3] https://github.com/tianocore/edk2/tree/master/OvmfPkg

Change-Id: I1a30d8ed4ebe6c22eefd2d79322a24ae08aa7216

commit_message:
Correct ovn-dbs upgrade image id variable

In I8b5b25d03b86b2c44b2d47e5a0624e7dd13873da the variable
ovn_dbs_image_id was renamed to old_ovn_dbs_image_id but
one instance of it was left behind. This patch corrects
that.

Related-Bug: #1838971
Closes: rhbz#1758578
Change-Id: I5735210aad47411fdeb62d4dab45b1150ec3ea04

commit_message:
Switch to IPA-builder for building ironic-python-agent

Also update the documentation to purge any mentions of CoreOS images
and the deprecated ironic-agent element.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-02 14:05:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] multi numa nfv testing job

- This change adds two new job definitions for a single and multi node
  nfv job.
- This change adds two new nodeset that target the multi node lables
  "ubuntu-bionic-expanded" provided by fortnebula.

The fortnebula(FN) ubuntu-bionic-expanded lable provide a dual
numa guest with 16G of ram and 8CPU arraned in a toplogy
of 2 sockets each with 2 core each with 2 hyperthreads.

while this might change in the future, combined with the fact that
FN also provides nested vert it allows testing of cpu pinning,
hugepages, multi numa guest, realtime instance and other nfv features.

This job use those feature to add basic first party testing of nfv featuers.
This job can be extended in the future to do more advanced testing by
leveraging the whitebox tempest plugin.

Change-Id: I76ccf842e142ea91890abfb61d44b0725e9ee750

This job use those feature to add basic first party testing of nfv featuers.
This job can be extended in the future to do more advanced testing by
leveraging the whitebox tempest plugin.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672595/
Change-Id: I76ccf842e142ea91890abfb61d44b0725e9ee750

commit_message:
multi numa nfv testing job

- This change adds two new job definitions for a single and multi node
  nfv job.
- This change adds two new nodeset that target the multi node lables
  "ubuntu-bionic-expanded" provided by fortnebula.

The fortnebula(FN) ubuntu-bionic-expanded lable provide a dual
numa guest with 16G of ram and 8CPU arraned in a toplogy
of 2 sockets each with 2 core each with 2 hyperthreads.

while this might change in the future, combined with the fact that
FN also provides nested vert it allows testing of cpu pinning,
hugepages, multi numa guest, realtime instance and other nfv features.

This job use those feature to add basic first party testing of nfv featuers.
This job can be extended in the future to do more advanced testing by
leveraging the whitebox tempest plugin.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/640021/
Change-Id: I76ccf842e142ea91890abfb61d44b0725e9ee750

[{'created': '2018-08-17 20:17:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add exact match aggregate image properties matcher/filter

This filter is a variant of the AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation
but is distinct enough that it should likely be its own thing.

The reasoning behind it is that the existing filter is a little
to tolerant of missing image properties (when you really want it
to match exactly) and to setup your aggregates and images with that
filter is very tedious, fragile, and error prone.

So instead of that filter, this filter uses some of the same concepts
but is less tolerant of missing image properties (for example when
you setup a windows only hypervisor set you do not want other images
with various other properties to end up there).

commit_message:
Add exact match aggregate image properties matcher/filter

This filter is a variant of the AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation
but is distinct enough that it should likely be its own thing.

The reasoning behind it is that the existing filter is a little
to tolerant of missing image properties (when you really want it
to match exactly) and to setup your aggregates and images with that
filter is very tedious, fragile, and error prone.

So instead of that filter, this filter uses some of the same concepts
but is less tolerant of missing image properties (for example when
you setup a windows only hypervisor set you do not want other images
with various other properties to end up there).

Co-author: Elancheran Subramanian <esubramanian@godaddy.com>

Change-Id: I9ba17489b914edeb7e882380d98ac497ddc0b383

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I77a5cbfdb6e58b81618b579c58b2af1aaf849b6c
Closes-Bug:  #1801484

commit_message:
Migrate to Zuul v3 native jobs

This corrects the path handling in the CI and removes a lot of
redundancy in the CI definitions. Also adds fixed log collection
from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649526/ to make the CI pass.

Removes handling of ZUUL_CHANGES. It is not present in new jobs,
and its use case in Bifrost is completely unclear.

Eventually, we should rewrite the whole test-bifrost.sh in ansible,
but that's a much bigger task.

Change-Id: Id893e816a7806e7d75282628817288d8a34ab8af

commit_message:
Refactor CONTRIBUTING.rst

I've been noticed that this file is very OpenStack generic and doesn't help
contributors to find the Nova-specific documentation about our contributing
process.
Here is a first take of what I think we can document easily without maintaining
too hardly but comments or other patch sets are welcome.

Change-Id: I36cf1d030627101d21cb143a8b900a1c78d19fca

without actually performing any modifications.

This should allow automated systems that want to source control (git or
inventory generated) how their cells are setup and managed.

commit_message:
Add apply_cells to nova-manage

This adds a new apply_cells method to the nova-manage commands that
reads in a specification file (json or yaml) and sets up the
configurations based on the specifications within the file. This
feature matches cell_mappings to specifications based on its name and
will "make-it-so" for cell_mappings by:
* create_cell (spec exists with a name not already in cell_mappings),
* update_cell (spec and mapping exist, but have different values),
* delete_cell (spec file does not have a matching cell by name).

There is a --dry-run argument that can be used to see what would change
without actually performing any modifications.

This should allow automated systems that want to source control (git or
inventory generated) how their cells are setup and managed.

Change-Id: I7a60a02637d85f576d4be6d9ea8a5e2a01360d0c
